body.name: Lenovo G27-20 27-inch Gaming Monitor, FHD, IPS, 144Hz, 1ms, FreeSync Premium and NVIDIA G-SYNC Compatible, NearEdgeless, VESA Mount, Height and Tilt Adjust, HDMI, DP
features: 27" IPS FHD panel with 1920 x 1080 full HD resolution to render stunning game graphics with no color distortion, even at the widest possible viewing angles
Rapid refresh rate of 144Hz, 1ms MPRT response time for fluid motion
AMD Radeon Freesync Premium and NVIDIA G-SYNC Compatible
This NearEdgeless gaming monitor has thin bezels on 3 sides for maximum viewing space
Height-adjustable stand offers -5° / 22° tilt angle and VESA mount capability. HDMI 1.4 and DisplayPort 1.2 1.2 connectivity
body.description: When it comes to performance, the Lenovo G27-20 gaming monitor's got game. Let's start with its 27-inch 1920 x 1080 full HD resolution In-Plane Switching (IPS) panel display that delivers startlingly life-like lighting effects to gameplay in a luminous 400 cd/m2, thanks to HDR decoding on-the-fly. This computer gaming monitor never misses a beat, even in the most intense moments, because its speedy 144Hz refresh rate and 1ms MPRT response time, coupled with AMD Radeon FreeSync™ Premium*, remove image stutter, break, tear and streak from the experience, leaving a smooth, fluid unspoiled session. This 3-side NearEdgeless monitor is also NVIDIA® G-SYNC® Compatible*, so you're ready to win with either graphics card. Besides, the 99% sRGB color gamut display featuring true 8-bit color will make your gameplay impressive for sure.As bright as this display is, you'll watch and game comfortably because TÜV Rheinland Low Blue Light and TÜV Rheinland Flicker Free technology can help protect your eyes from blue light harm on a sliding scale, as well as cut out screen flicker. Plus, with an anti-glare display, you'll enhance your viewing pleasure with a vastly reduced chance of eye fatigue. Aside from eye comfort, the G27-20 gaming monitor's new future-cool form factor helps comfortable sitting, too. Its upgraded Vector V base with modern blue accent lifts the screen head a full 130 mm and tilts between -5° and 22° to always be in the most ergonomic position for endless hours of comfortable E-Sports or binge-watching a show that just dropped. Lenovo Artery software (for Windows 10) gives gamers the chance to seamlessly tweak screen performance to optimize their gameplay experience directly on screen through their PC. Save time with zero distractions.* AMD Radeon FreeSync™ can only work with an AMD Radeon™ series graphics card. NVIDIA® G-SYNC® Compatible works only with Compatible NVIDIA® GeForce® graphics card

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Let your game shine G27-20 holds a 27-inch FHD 1920 x 1080 resolution In-Plane Switching panel display to render stunning game graphics with no color distortion, even at the widest possible viewing angles. Bright and right, with HDR decoding viewers are treated to a bright 400 cd/m2 display, while colors are bright, vivid and compellingly lifelike thanks to the 99% sRGB color gamut and true 8-bit color.
Utterly stutter-free gaming With NVIDIA G-SYNC Compatible3 technology, removes image stutter, break, tear and streak from the experience, leaving a smooth, fluid unspoilt session.

Never miss a beat Nothing but smooth, natural movement as far as the eye can see. G27-20 delivers fluid motion thanks to its rapid refresh rate of 144Hz and 1ms MPRT2 response time. That means players can enjoy the spoils of victory, not suffer the spoils of torn frames, image lag or motion blur. Let the action flow.

Comfort dialed to the max Play and display. G27-20’s sci-fi chic looks bring an edge to any gaming room. Carrying TÜV Rheinland Low Blue Light and TÜV Rheinland Flicker Free certification, its flicker-free and variable Low Blue Light settings reduce eye fatigue. While its stand lifts and tilts the screen to the ideal height for users’ comfort. Lenovo Artery software gives gamers the chance to seamlessly tweak screen performance to optimize their gameplay experience directly on screen through their PC.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for the money.
reviews.reviewText: For a monitor of its class (1080p) this monitor has proven its worth with a respectable refresh rate clear picture quality and ease of use. Currently my fiancé has 2 of these monitors mounted to a standard VESA mount for work and gaming and has been nothing but ecstatic. the professional look and durable feel just add to the dual use of these monitors not to flashy for an office while still able to handle regular gaming at a high quality for the pixel density, in short, I would highly recommend This monitor for anyone interested in a duel 1080p monitor setup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Gaming Monitor
reviews.reviewText: Highly satisfied with this monitor, fulfilled everything I hoped it would be.

reviews.reviewText: Not worth the price plus it went down $30.00 after I ordered returned it nice picture bit can get a 4k for same pr oh ce

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Calidad de imagen y el peso
reviews.reviewText: Lo uso para mi PC se ve excellent

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great as an external monitor for a Steam Deck
reviews.reviewText: Bought this used in "good condition" from Amazon and the product received was indeed in good condition.Pros:- The picture is bright, colorful, and vibrant. The bezels around the sides and top are about .25 in and the bottom one is about .75 in.- Refresh rate is as high as advertised and the features/osd menu allow for overclocking and motion blur compensation of some sort but I don't have a need to use those.- Enabling sRGB prevents adjusting brightness which is annoying but not uncommon especially in budget monitors.Cons:- Height adjustment of the stand isn't working, again I purchased this used so I expected something to be amiss and this isn't a dealbreaker I contacted Amazon support who ended up forwarding me to Lenovo support but I had to deduct a star from the product.- The On Screen Display (OSD) is accessed from the buttons on the back side of the monitor and are pressed with your right hand looking at it. The menu is not intuitive at all, even with the manual open it's hard to accomplish anything with ease. I would deduct a point here if I didn't already for the stand but at the end of the day I ideally set the monitor up once and then I'm done so I very rarely go through the headache of having to fight the menu. If someone from Lenovo reads this do better product testing because there's no way anyone used this and thought it was good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Top notch monitor, but a little pricey for 1080p
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this monitor, I have it mounted on a double arm mount, and looks great. I mostly play siege and the 1ms response time is great, very smooth and love the 144hz. It is a bit pricey for 1080p monitors, maybe a year or 2 ago the price would be acceptable, but you can get a premium (asus, acer lg etc) for the same price.It isn't a deal breaker, but if this was lowered to the 200 mark, it would definitely be a top seller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lenovo G27-20 27-inch Gaming Monitor
reviews.reviewText: Out of the box this monitor is thin and reasonably light-weight but feels sturdy at the same time with no flimsy parts. The height-adjustable stand allows for many different viewing angles and positions.And the actual display during game-play is bright and sharp.. Images on screen really pop and look very smooth. And 27-inch is just right for my needs. A solid and great performing gaming monitor at a decent price too from Lenovo.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It's not special enough at $280
reviews.reviewText: There's plenty of other monitors you can get with these same specs for $50 less easily, so this one would have to be extra special to be worth it, and I really don't think it is.I've been using this primarily in conjunction with a 360Hz laptop and despite the large difference, it's still an extremely smooth display. The colors are fine out of the box, but they had better be because the entire OSD menu is bugged (at least on my unit) so there is no way to change anything other than the brightness, the other menus simply don't let me in.For gaming, it works surprisingly well. I have a 32" 1440p monitor that feels like it has more visible pixels than this 27" 1080p monitor. I generally would not recommend 1080p at any screen size above 24" but I can't take off any stars for that here since some people still want it. The back light bleed is minimal and I didn't have any other issues with the display.The stand is cheap and doesn't give any adjustability aside from some tilt, so again, I don't see any reason for the price premium of this monitor.I feel like this could very easily be worth 5 stars if they fixed the OSD and decreased the price, but as of now it looks like you're paying for more and getting less than the competition, especially when you can get a 1440p 144hz monitor at the same size for the same price.
